decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently generate a large amount of mana through cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, allowing the player to cast multiple spells in a single turn. By using rituals and cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig through the deck and find key combo pieces such as Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam, the deck aims to ultimately win the game by casting a large storm spell and dealing lethal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of disruption spells like Duress and Cabal Therapy helps to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay by utilizing cheap and efficient spells like Lightning Bolt, Force of Will, and Daze to disrupt opponents while maintaining card advantage with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Wasteland and Cabal Therapy to control the opponent's mana and hand. The creatures in the deck, including Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler, provide quick and efficient threats to close out the game quickly.

The deck aims to utilize the graveyard as a resource to quickly fill it with cards like Bridge from Below, Ichorid, and Golgari Grave-Troll. Through cards like Faithless Looting and Breakthrough, the player can quickly dump cards into the graveyard and trigger powerful effects such as reanimating creatures and creating zombie tokens. The deck relies on quick and explosive plays to overwhelm the opponent and establish a strong board presence, utilizing cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to establish card advantage through cards like Search for Azcanta and Jace, the Mind Sculptor while also having access to powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus. The inclusion of Counterbalance allows for additional disruption against the opponent's spells, creating a strong control shell that can outlast and outmaneuver the opponent in a long game.

The main concept of this deck is to use the dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Grave-Troll, while also utilizing cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Faithless Looting to enable explosive combos. By sacrificing creatures like Ichorid and Narcomoeba, players can trigger effects like Prized Amalgam and create a powerful board presence. The deck also utilizes cards like Cabal Therapy and Breakthrough to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain control of the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of control spells and disruptive creatures to manipulate and control the game. It aims to disrupt opponents' strategies with cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Kolaghan's Command, while also generating card advantage with Brainstorm and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also has a strong mana base to support its multicolor spell casting, including powerful cards like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. With a mix of removal, disruption, card advantage, and powerful threats, the deck aims to outlast opponents and control the game until it can secure a win condition.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly set up and execute the "Show and Tell" combo, which allows the player to cheat out big threats like Griselbrand and Emrakul onto the battlefield, bypassing their high mana costs. The deck includes a mix of card draw, counterspells, and fast mana sources to help consistently set up the combo and protect it from disruption. By efficiently casting these high impact threats early in the game, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through the use of mana denial cards like Thorn of Amethyst and Chalice of the Void, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager. The deck aims to lock down the opponent's resources while building a threatening board presence with powerful artifact creatures. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Sorcerous Spyglass and Phyrexian Revoker allows for further disruption of the opponent's strategies, making it difficult for them to mount a successful defense.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly generate mana through rituals and mana sources, allowing you to use Burning Wish to search for and cast Belcher, which can deal direct damage to your opponent if enough cards are revealed from your library. The deck focuses on speed and efficiency to quickly assemble the combo and win the game before your opponent has a chance to respond. It aims to be a high-risk, high-reward strategy that can catch opponents off guard with its explosive plays.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana through Cloudposts and other mana-producing artifacts to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures. Using Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void to disrupt opponents' spells, the strategy revolves around overwhelming opponents with large, hard-to-deal-with creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck also includes utility cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Endbringer to control the board and maintain tempo. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence and quickly close out the game with massive Eldrazi threats.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes disruption cards like Cabal Therapy and Spell Pierce to control the board and protect its threats. Additionally, the deck runs a suite of cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency and card selection. With a mana base centered around dual lands and Wasteland to disrupt opponent's mana, this deck aims to quickly close out games through a combination of creatures and burn spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. Utilizing mana acceleration from lands such as Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple, as well as disruption from Chalice of the Void, this deck aims to apply pressure early and close out the game with huge threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The inclusion of versatile cards like Warping Wail and Dismember provide additional answers to opposing strategies, while the Eldrazi Mimic and Endless One provide early threats to start the beatdown.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently and quickly generate a high storm count to cast powerful spells like Ad Nauseam or Burning Wish and win the game in just one turn. The deck includes various cards to aid in generating mana quickly, filtering through the deck to find the necessary pieces, and disrupting the opponent's plans. By chaining together spells like Dark Ritual, Rite of Flame, and Infernal Tutor, the deck aims to create a lethal storm combo and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to react.

The deck focuses on utilizing mana acceleration and powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently. By ramping into big threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer early in the game, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while disrupting their strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void and Sorcerous Spyglass. Eldrazi Temple, Eye of Ugin, and other mana sources help ensure that the deck can consistently deploy its threats ahead of schedule, making it a formidable force in the Legacy format.

The main focus of this Jund aggro deck is to disrupt your opponent's hand with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Lightning Bolt. Additionally, the deck aims to generate card advantage and pressure with cards like Liliana of the Veil, Dark Confidant, and Goblin Rabblemaster. The mana base is designed to support these strategies, with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent mana production and access to all colors needed for the spells in the deck.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents while applying pressure with efficient threats such as True-Name Nemesis and Noble Hierarch. It utilizes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to control the game while leveraging the powerful card advantage engines of Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The mana denial strategy backed up by Wasteland and aggressive creatures allows for tempo advantage and efficient removal with cards like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay. The deck aims to apply pressure and disrupt opponents' plans to secure victory.
